attributes.action: Politicians receive consequences after offensive comments on social media.
attributes.additional_details:
13 August 2018
'Ex Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson faces a Tory Party Enquiry after saying women in burkas looked like"letter boxes" or "bank robbers".'

16 March 2018
'A labour councillor, Jim Dempster, told transport officials at a meeting that "No-one would have seen Mr Yousaf under his burka".'
attributes.background:
On the news we have seen many politicians,for example Boris Johnson, misuse social media and target different groups and races and comment offensively in regards to them.
Please support our petition so politicians like Boris can receive consequences for their misuse of language.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because it isn't clear what it is asking the UK Government or Parliament to do. In any case, the UK Government and Parliament as a whole aren't responsible for investigating comments made by individual MPs. This is the responsibility of their political party.
